conclusion: Need to analyze v-t graphs to find when objects A and B are farthest apart.
Velocity-time graph for object A is a straight line with positive slope.
Velocity-time graph for object B is a curve that decreases, reaches a minimum, then increases.
Position of an object can be determined by integrating its velocity over time.
Displacement for object A can be calculated as area under the line from starting point to any given time.
Displacement for object B is the area under its curve from starting point to any given time.
Initially, both objects start from the same position.
Object A's velocity increases linearly, meaning its displacement increases steadily.
Object B's velocity decreases initially, reaches a minimum, then increases, meaning it moves slower than object A initially.
Maximum separation occurs when difference in displacements is greatest.
At time t1, object B reaches minimum velocity, moving the least compared to object A.
After t1, object B increases velocity, reducing displacement difference.
At time t2, both objects have the same velocity, and difference in positions will start to decrease.
Objects are farthest apart at time t1.
